004
005package edu.wpi.first.networktables;
006
007import java.util.function.Consumer;
008
009/**
010 * Connection listener. This calls back to a callback function when a connection change occurs. The
011 * callback function is called asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use
012 * synchronization or atomics when accessing any shared state from the callback function.
013 */
014public final class ConnectionListener implements AutoCloseable {
015  /**
016   * Create a listener for connection changes.
017   *
018   * @param inst Instance
019   * @param immediateNotify if notification should be immediately created for existing connections
020   * @param listener Listener function
021   */
022  public ConnectionListener(
023      NetworkTableInstance inst,
024      boolean immediateNotify,
025      Consumer<ConnectionNotification> listener) {
026    m_inst = inst;
027    m_handle = inst.addConnectionListener(immediateNotify, listener);
028  }
029
030  @Override
031  public synchronized void close() {
032    if (m_handle != 0) {
033      m_inst.removeConnectionListener(m_handle);
034      m_handle = 0;
035    }
036  }
037
038  /**
039   * Determines if the native handle is valid.
040   *
041   * @return True if the native handle is valid, false otherwise.
042   */
043  public boolean isValid() {
044    return m_handle != 0;
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Gets the native handle.
049   *
050   * @return Native handle
051   */
052  public int getHandle() {
053    return m_handle;
054  }
055
056  /**
057   * Wait for the connection listener queue to be empty. This is primarily useful for deterministic
058   * testing. This blocks until either the connection listener queue is empty (e.g. there are no
059   * more events that need to be passed along to callbacks or poll queues) or the timeout expires.
060   *
061   * @param timeout timeout, in seconds. Set to 0 for non-blocking behavior, or a negative value to
062   *     block indefinitely
063   * @return False if timed out, otherwise true.
064   */
065  public boolean waitForQueue(double timeout) {
066    return m_inst.waitForConnectionListenerQueue(timeout);
067  }
068
069  private final NetworkTableInstance m_inst;
070  private int m_handle;
071}
